documents.title: Building in CLI | Camoufox
documents.description: Camoufox's build system is designed to be used in Linux. WSL will not work!
documents.summary: This document outlines the command-line options and usage for a cross-platform build script used to target multiple operating systems and hardware architectures.

documents.title: Stealth Overview | Camoufox
documents.description: There has been a year gap in maintenance due to a personal situation.
documents.summary: This document explains the technical mechanisms Camoufox uses to evade anti-bot detection, including its use of sandboxing, C++ level fingerprint spoofing, and isolated browser protocols.

documents.title: Virtual Display | Camoufox
documents.description: While Camoufox includes patches to prevent headless detection, running in headless mode may still be detectable in the future.
documents.summary: This document explains how to use a virtual display buffer to run Camoufox headlessly, helping to prevent bot detection on Linux systems.

documents.title: Introduction | Camoufox
documents.description: Invisible to anti-bot systemsðŸŽ­
documents.summary: Camoufox is an open-source anti-detect browser built on Firefox that uses low-level fingerprint injection and rotation to bypass anti-bot systems. It mimics real-world user behavior and hardware characteristics to provide a robust, undetectable automation environment.

documents.title: Building in Docker | Camoufox
documents.description: To build Camoufox on a non-Linux system you can use Docker.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for building Camoufox on non-Linux systems using Docker, covering image creation, cross-platform compilation, and volume mounting.

documents.title: Build System | Camoufox
documents.description: Here is a diagram of the build system, and its associated make commands:
documents.summary: This document provides an overview of the Camoufox build system architecture and the specific make commands used to compile and package the browser for multiple platforms.

documents.title: Remote Server | Camoufox
documents.description: Warning! This feature is experimental. It uses a hacky workaround to gain access to undocumented Playwright methods.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for running Camoufox as a remote websocket server and connecting to it using the Playwright API.

documents.title: Features List | Camoufox
documents.description: Below is a list of patches and features implemented in Camoufox.
documents.summary: This document outlines the features and technical patches of Camoufox, a modified Firefox browser designed for anti-fingerprinting, stealth automation, and performance optimization.

documents.title: BrowserForge Integration | Camoufox
documents.description: Camoufox is compatible with BrowserForge fingerprints.
documents.summary: This document explains how to use and customize BrowserForge fingerprints in Camoufox, covering both automatic generation and manual injection of fingerprint objects.

documents.title: Python Interface | Camoufox
documents.description: Camoufox's Python library wraps around Playwright's API to help automatically generate & inject unique device characteristics into Camoufox such as...
documents.summary: This document introduces the Camoufox Python library, a lightweight Playwright wrapper designed to automate device fingerprinting and geolocation configuration to avoid detection.

documents.title: Development Tools | Camoufox
documents.description: This repo comes with a developer UI under scripts/developer.py:
documents.summary: This document explains how to use the developer UI tool to create, modify, and manage source code patches within the repository.

documents.title: Development | Camoufox
documents.description: The following content is intended for those interested in building & debugging Camoufox.
documents.summary: This document provides technical instructions and resource links for building the Camoufox browser and developing patches to address security leaks.

documents.title: Main World Execution | Camoufox
documents.description: By default, all JavaScript execution is ran in an isolated scope, invisible to the page.
documents.summary: This document explains how to interact with and modify the DOM using Camoufox by switching between isolated and main world JavaScript execution scopes.

documents.title: WebGL Research | Camoufox
documents.description: As of January 2025, a newer fingerprint generation library with WebGL is in the works!
documents.summary: This document lists hardware and software configurations for the ANGLE graphics layer, detailing compatibility and distribution percentages across various GPU vendors and drivers.

documents.title: Passing Config | Camoufox
documents.description: If needed, Camoufox config data can be overridden/passed as a dictionary to the config parameter.
documents.summary: This document explains how to manually override or pass additional configuration data to Camoufox using the config dictionary parameter.

documents.title: Usage | Camoufox
documents.description: Camoufox is fully compatible with your existing Playwright code. You only have to change your browser initialization:
documents.summary: This document provides a detailed reference for Camoufox initialization parameters, covering configuration options for browser fingerprinting, geolocation, and stealth features.

documents.title: GeoIP & Proxy Support | Camoufox
documents.description: By passing geoip=True, or passing in a target IP address, Camoufox will automatically use the target IP's longitude, latitude, timezone, country,...
documents.summary: This document explains how to use the Camoufox GeoIP feature to automatically spoof geographic and regional browser metadata based on a proxy or target IP address.

documents.title: Miscellaneous | Camoufox
documents.description: Property
documents.summary: This document outlines configuration properties for spoofing a browser's battery status and PDF viewer settings to help prevent headless browser detection.

documents.title: Leak Debugging | Camoufox
documents.description: This is a flow chart demonstrating my process for determining leaks without deobfuscating WAF Javascript.
documents.summary: This document outlines a systematic debugging process for identifying browser leaks that trigger WAF detection by incrementally applying Camoufox patches to a vanilla Firefox build.

documents.title: Installation | Camoufox
documents.description: First, install the camoufox package:
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for installing the Camoufox library and lists the available commands for its command-line interface.

documents.title: Fingerprint Injection | Camoufox
documents.description: In Camoufox, data is intercepted at the C++ implementation level, making the changes undetectable through JavaScript inspection.
documents.summary: This document explains how Camoufox handles browser fingerprint spoofing at the C++ level and provides instructions on configuring spoofed properties via its Python interface.

documents.title: Addons | Camoufox
documents.description: In the Camoufox Python library, addons can be loaded with the addons parameter.
documents.summary: This document explains how to manage browser extensions in the Camoufox library, covering how to load custom extracted addons and exclude default ones like uBlock Origin.

documents.title: Fonts | Camoufox
documents.description: Fonts can be passed to be used in Camoufox through the fonts config property.
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive list of system font names and families, including localized versions and specialized script-specific typefaces.

documents.summary: This document explains how to configure and use human-like cursor movement and visual highlighters in the Camoufox browser.
